bib.title: Validity of household survey indicators to monitor food security in time and space: Burkina Faso case study
bib.author: Hugo Deléglise and Yves Gérard Bazié and Agnès Bégué and Roberto Interdonato and Mathieu Roche and Maguelonne Teisseire and Elodie Maître d’Hôtel
bib.abstract: The timely and accurate identification of food insecurity situations represents a challenging issue. Household surveys are routinely used in low-income countries and are an essential tool for obtaining key food security indicators that are used by decision makers to determine the targets of food security interventions.This paper investigates the spatial and temporal quality of the food security indicators obtained through household surveys. The empirical case of Burkina Faso is used in this paper, where a large-scale rural household survey has been conducted yearly since 2009.
